teamEvals.description: RIP. Not going to lie, this is horrid. Good luck winning a game. This team can't be helped.
You're going to need a miracle to win a game. Start praying for the NFL overlords to shine upon you.
You can't win with this. Other players will laugh at this team. Sorry.
At least it's not a dumpster fire but it's going to be hard to win.
You may have one good player here but you better be swapping some players out in the free agency pool.
Not the best but you have some core players you want to keep. As is, you are not winning much but make some changes and you can win some games.
This is rough but you have core players to keep or trade one for multiple good players. It's going to be hard but you can win.
Not the worst but not the best. You can win games but changes are needed to push for any hint of the playoffs.
Below average draft. You're going to need to make changes. Trades, free agents, well-timed plays are going to be needed to push for playoffs.
Slightly below average draft. You're going to struggle but the free agent wire will be your best friend. Watch it often.
Average draft. You can win with this and you can lose with this.
Slightly above average draft. You could run with this but a trade or key free agent pickup will be needed for a deep run.
Above average draft. With a few changes throughout the year you can make a playoff push.
Good job, you're going to need a few key pickups or drops at the right time, but you can win a lot of games.
Solid draft, with a few good moves you can make a strong push.
With a few moves and good planning, you are in the running for a trophy.
Great picks, you are in a good position to win it all.
Amazing team, are you an NFL Scout?.
If you don't win that shmoney, you tried to lose.
The best team ever created. Enjoy your Fantasy SuperBowl Trophy.

players.name: Tom Brady
players.oneLiner: The G.O.A.T. Draft him.

players.name: Dak Prescott
players.oneLiner: Dak goes ham. Premium.

players.name: Josh Allen
players.oneLiner: Dual-Threat with a Rocket arm. Pick him.

players.name: Lamar Jackson
players.oneLiner: The running G.O.A.T. Draft him.

players.name: Kirk Cousins
players.oneLiner: Above average player when he doesn't line up behind the wrong lineman.

players.name: Patrick Mahomes
players.oneLiner: The baby G.O.A.T. New era greatness.

players.name: Kyler Murray
players.oneLiner: Baby Yoda on steriods. A top pick.

players.name: Derek Carr
players.oneLiner: A solid QB. Better than his brother.

players.name: Matthew Stafford
players.oneLiner: The broken G.O.A.T. Tough as nails and plays through injuries. Always injured.

players.name: Justin Herbert
players.oneLiner: Upcoming new era QB. Draft him if the goats are gone.

players.name: Jameis Winston
players.oneLiner: Very lucky he's getting another shot somewhere else. Don't draft.

players.name: Carson Wentz
players.oneLiner: When not hurt he's even worse on the field. Don't even sniff this one.

players.name: Joe Burrow
players.oneLiner: A good option, will get better as the year goes on.

players.name: Russell Wilson
players.oneLiner: A true winner and a magician in the pocket.

players.name: Jimmy Garoppolo
players.oneLiner: Jimmy G shouldn't be your starter but he can ball out when he's not throwing the ball to the other team.

players.name: Tua Tagovailoa
players.oneLiner: Needs more weapons around him. He's aight.

players.name: Taylor Heinicke
players.oneLiner: Wouldn't want him as my QB but he can ball out when consistent.

players.name: Tyrod Taylor
players.oneLiner: Serviceable backup but don't start him unless absolutely necessary.

players.name: Jalen Hurts
players.oneLiner: Probably getting benched in real life. Stay away.

players.name: Teddy Bridgewater
players.oneLiner: Donate him an ACL, PCL, and MCL and he can play football. About it.

players.name: Matt Ryan
players.oneLiner: How are you going to lose when you're up 27-3 in the SuperBowl. Enough said.

players.name: Mac Jones
players.oneLiner: Mac Attack doesn't need a 6-pack. Draft him.

players.name: Jared Goff
players.oneLiner: Please don't do it to yourself. Pick someone else.

players.name: Justin Fields
players.oneLiner: Still learning but could progress through the season. A good backup option.

players.name: Trevor Lawrence
players.oneLiner: Don't do it, nothing flashy here and not a good supporting cast.

players.name: Ben Roethilsberger
players.oneLiner: Old and washed Hall of Famer. Wayyyyyy past his prime. Don't draft.

players.name: Zach Wilson
players.oneLiner: A chance to learn and be better.....but it's the Jets.... don't draft.

players.name: Daniel Jones
players.oneLiner: Almost certain he has more turnovers than touchdowns. Not even going to look it up. Don't draft.

players.name: Ryan Tannehill
players.oneLiner: A good QB when all of his support is there. A good backup option.

players.name: Baker Mayfield
players.oneLiner: Inconsistent but good enough to start if needed in a pinch.

players.name: Aaron Rodgers
players.oneLiner: A great QB when he's not lying to people.

players.name: Cam Newton
players.oneLiner: Just retire big homie. Please don't draft him on your team. You'll lose.

players.name: Christian McCaffrey
players.oneLiner: A monster athlete who can do it all when not on the injury report.

players.name: Derrick Henry
players.oneLiner: The best running back in the league. All hail King Henry.

players.name: Dalvin Cook
players.oneLiner: A good choice. Just hope he doesn't get hurt.

players.name: Nick Chubb
players.oneLiner: Amazing choice. Has to split time with Kareem Hunt but can still eat.

players.name: Ezekiel Elliot
players.oneLiner: Loves to eat. On the field and off.... good value if taken past the mid first round.

players.name: Alvin Kamara
players.oneLiner: Point Per Reception League Monster. Will put up crazy points.

players.name: Austin Ekeler
players.oneLiner: An all-around great small running back. He'll get you tons of points.

players.name: Aaron Jones
players.oneLiner: Very solid running back on a good team. Can put up huge games and then go MIA in that offense.

players.name: Jonahan Taylor
players.oneLiner: Upcoming workhorse who will only get better. Draft if you can.

players.name: Saquon Barkley
players.oneLiner: Could be the best running back in the league but he can NEVER stay on the field longer than the injury report. Draft responsibly.

players.name: Najee Harris
players.oneLiner: Going to be great in a few years. Solid pick right now.

players.name: Joe Mixon
players.oneLiner: When he's punching in touchdowns and not people, he's really good.

players.name: Antonio Gibson
players.oneLiner: A good flex option, nothing more. Don't let him be in your two RB slots....don't do it...

players.name: Clyde Edwards-Helaire
players.oneLiner: Being on one of the top offenses ever seen does him wonders but he can be overshadowed. A good pickup.

players.name: David Montgomery
players.oneLiner: Good talent but on a bad offense. Draft at your own risk.

players.name: Chris Carson
players.oneLiner: Just Meh. Up to you on this one pal.

players.name: James Robinson
players.oneLiner: One of the only good pieces on the Jaguars offense.

players.name: Josh Jacobs
players.oneLiner: Should put up good points at any point during the season. Inconsistent but worth a pick.

players.name: D'Andre Swift
players.oneLiner: Spectacular talent when he's not in the trainer's office on the injury report. Be wary

players.name: Gus Edwards
players.oneLiner: Not even as good at running as his QB. Only worth starting if absolutely necessary.

players.name: Darrell Henderson
players.oneLiner: Decent but not someone you want to pick up.

players.name: Miles Sanders
players.oneLiner: Good when the offense works but only worth a late round pick.

players.name: Mike Davis
players.oneLiner: A late round selection but he's on a very bad offense. Stay away.

players.name: Myles Gaskin
players.oneLiner: Eww.

players.name: Damien Harris
players.oneLiner: Talent isn't the problem, opportunity is. Rated low simply because he's in a 3-headed system. Some value late.

players.name: Melvin Gordon
players.oneLiner: When not on injured reserve he's decent. Don't pick though.

players.name: Raheem Mostert
players.oneLiner: He's so fast. One of the fastest. When he's not in a wheelchair. It's a no for me dawg.

players.name: Michael Carter
players.oneLiner: He's on the Jets. RIP.

players.name: James Connor
players.oneLiner: Inconsistent and points come in bunches when used. Late round pick.

players.name: Jamaal Williams
players.oneLiner: He's awesome as a person but as a player on the Lions.....big nope.

players.name: Leonard Fournette
players.oneLiner: Lenny is aight but points come in bunches. Late round value.

players.name: Devin Singletary
players.oneLiner: He's good but shares a workload. Will get catches and could be a decent flex option. Mid round value.

players.name: Devante Adams
players.oneLiner: A point machine. This is the best grab you can get.

players.name: Stefon Diggs
players.oneLiner: Tons of catches. All the catches. Grab him if you can.

players.name: Tyreek Hill
players.oneLiner: Points come in bunches and often. Very streaky but worth a top pick.

players.name: DeAndre Hopkins
players.oneLiner: Catches everything and worth every bit of a top pick. Best WR in the NFL?

players.name: DK Metcalf
players.oneLiner: Is he a human? Superman? We're not sure yet....pick him up anyway.

players.name: Keenan Allen
players.oneLiner: A receptions master. He can catch anything when he's not catching injuries.

players.name: AJ Brown
players.oneLiner: One of the young ones being great. Will only get better. Worthy of a top pick.

players.name: Allen Robinson
players.oneLiner: Criminally underrated talent when he's on the field and not the injury cart. A good pickup.

players.name: Justin Jefferson
players.oneLiner: A young force in the game that will only get better as the season goes on. A top pick.

players.name: Scary `Terry` McLaurin
players.oneLiner: He's scary good at everything. His quarterback situation is scarier...

players.name: CeeDee Lamb
players.oneLiner: CeeDee is going to see deez TD's. Pick him up.

players.name: Cooper Kupp
players.oneLiner: On a historic pace to be one of the best WR in the NFL. Whether that's true or not, he'll get you crazy points.

players.name: Mike Evans
players.oneLiner: A big-bodied master at the point of catch. He's gonna get catches and TD's. Pick him up.

players.name: Diontae Johnson
players.oneLiner: A good player with a bad qb situation. Stay away or pick at your own risk.

players.name: DJ Moore
players.oneLiner: A solid choice in the later rounds. He'll get lots of receptions.

players.name: Jerry Jeudy
players.oneLiner: The best WR on their team but with a shaky QB situation, pick at your own risk.

players.name: JaMarr Chase
players.oneLiner: This Rookie of the Year will be an all-time great if he keeps playing like he is. He could vie for your top picks.

players.name: Keenan Allen
players.oneLiner: A receptions master. He can catch anything when he's not catching injuries.

players.name: Keenan Allen
players.oneLiner: A receptions master. He can catch anything when he's not catching injuries.

players.name: Keenan Allen
players.oneLiner: A receptions master. He can catch anything when he's not catching injuries.

players.name: Keenan Allen
players.oneLiner: A receptions master. He can catch anything when he's not catching injuries.
